New Records: Shohei Ohtani set a major league record by homering and stealing a base in the same game for the 14th time
Key Match Events: Teoscar Hernández hit a go-ahead homer in the sixth inning
Ohtani legged out an infield single to first base and then stole second
Ohtani had a go-ahead homer with two outs in the fifth
Pre-Game Insights: Dodgers manager Dave Roberts emphasized the importance of strong bullpen performance
Post-Match Reflections: Dodgers manager Dave Roberts praised Ohtani's focus and performance
Teoscar Hernández expressed his appreciation for being a teammate with Ohtani
Miscellaneous Highlights: The win reduced the NL West-leading Dodgers' magic number to four to clinch the division
Ohtani became the first player in major league history to hit 50 homers and steal 50 bases in a season at Miami
Others: Rockies got home runs by Charlie Blackmon, Hilliard and Michael Toglia
Alex Vesia got the victory with one inning of relief
